title: Development of Self-Directed Physics E-Modules: Independent Curriculum Design

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Focus on developing e-modules that enable students to transition from traditional lecture-based education to self-directed learning. Conducted in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, incorporating experimental simulations and interactive content

learning_goals: Students will self-directly learn core physics concepts (e.g., kinematics, mechanics, conservation of energy) and reach at least 80% comprehension.
Students will analyze physical phenomena using simulation tools provided in e-modules and submit experimental results in report form within 72 hours.
Students measure their ability to apply learning content through module assessments and achieve a score of 75 or above (out of 100) in the summative evaluation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
